all_text_timv: Green, John, 1977- An abundance of Katherines / John Green. 1st ed. New York, NY : Dutton Books, [2006] ©2006 227 pages ; 24 cm text txt rdacontent unmediated n rdamedia volume nc rdacarrier Includes bibliographical references. Having been recently dumped for the nineteenth time by a girl named Katherine, recent high school graduate and former child prodigy Colin sets off on a road trip with his best friend to try to find some new direction in life while also trying to create a mathematical formula to explain his relationships. Purchased with funds from the  Paterno Libraries Endowment; 2013 A Junior Library Guild selection. Michael L. Printz Honor for Excellence in Young Adult Literature, 2007. Interpersonal relations Fiction. Self-perception Fiction. Mathematics Fiction. Interpersonal relations Juvenile fiction. Self-perception Juvenile fiction. Mathematics Juvenile fiction.
